Package com.example.chinesecheckers.utils.FriendRequest

Class FriendRequestCustomAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • android.widget.ArrayAdapter<FriendRequestModel>
        • com.example.chinesecheckers.utils.FriendRequest.FriendRequestCustomAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.Filterable, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter, android.widget.ThemedSpinnerAdapter
    public class FriendRequestCustomAdapter
extends android.widget.ArrayAdapter<FriendRequestModel>
    FriendRequestCustomAdapter displays friend requests as a list and determines the layout that each row is implemented by based on the friend request type. The list allows users to accept or delete incoming requests and to delete outgoing requests.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FriendRequestCustomAdapter

        public FriendRequestCustomAdapter​(android.app.Activity activity,
                                  UserModel user,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<FriendRequestModel> data,
                                  FriendRequestEnum requestType)
        The constructor takes an activity to know where the adapter is being displayed. It requires the user of whom is loading their friend requests. It has an array list of all the friend requests and what type of requests it is displaying.
        Parameters:
        activity - - current activity
        user - - logged in user
        data - - list of all friend requests of given type
        requestType - - friend requests type, INCOMING or OUTGOING

    • Method Detail

      • getView

        public android.view.View getView​(int position,
                                 android.view.View convertView,
                                 android.view.ViewGroup parent)
        getView generates the view for the activity by inflating either incoming requests layout or outgoing requests layout. It then creates the buttons to accept or delete a friend request.
        Specified by:
        getView in interface android.widget.Adapter
        Overrides:
        getView in class android.widget.ArrayAdapter<FriendRequestModel>
        Parameters:
        position - - position of the view
        convertView - - the view that we will change to display our data
        parent - - the parent of our adapter view
        Returns:
        - our now custom convertView
